enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Earth and Planetary Sciences majors & minors during the pre-registration period.
title: WCAS EARTH 203-0-01 Earth System History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course covers the evolution of the Earth's dynamic systems and its
record through geological time. Emphasis of the course is on the evolution of life as determined from the evidence of the fossil record.
Topics include the development of the geological time scale, the basic axioms of geochronology, stratigraphic and radiometric dating, the evolution of life, climate and the surface of the earth over time, and fossilization and identification of ancient landscapes and creatures.

Prerequisite: EARTH 201 or instructor consent.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
RECOMMENDED Textbook: Earth System History, 4th edition. Authors: Stanley and Luczaj. Purchase new for approx. $170, rent for approx. $60. ISBN-10: 1-4292-5526-9
http://www.macmillanlearning.com/Catalog/product/earthsystemhistory-fourthedition-stanley

subject: EARTH
